messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] thanks for your help
messages.msgSnippet: ... From: Barbara Miller  I just want to say thank you for all of you who have taken the time to answer my questions.  I think after
messages.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: Barbara Miller <BarbMiller@...>

I just want to say thank you for all of you who have taken the time
to
answer my questions. I think after reading the last few answers that,
as I
said in my last e-mail, my family is just too different philosophically
from
the views on the list, so I think it is time for me to hit that
unsubscribe
button. And please don't misunderstand me - I'm not mad or upset or
anything; I just think it would be in my best interest to leave and
therefore not waste any more of your time (or mine, lol). But, I am
thankful for the time I was on this list and am again appreciative of
your
help and I wish you well.

-=-=-=-

If you change your mind in a few weeks or months, we'll still be here.

Seriously---ideas change when we start *really* thinking about things.
We can't help it! <g>

We *know* we make people uncomfortable. Change is uncomfortable.

Good luck on your journey.



~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
http://liveandlearnconference.org

"The hardest problem for the brain is not learning, but forgetting. No
matter how hard we try, we can't deliberately forget something we have
learned, and that is catastrophic if we learn that we can't learn."
~Frank Smith


________________________________________________________________________
Check out AOL.com today. Breaking news, video search, pictures, email
and IM. All on demand. Always Free.

messages.subject: thanks for your help
messages.msgSnippet: I just want to say thank you for all of you who have taken the time to answer my questions.  I think after reading the last few answers that, as I said in my
messages.messageBody:
I just want to say thank you for all of you who have taken the time to
answer my questions. I think after reading the last few answers that, as I
said in my last e-mail, my family is just too different philosophically from
the views on the list, so I think it is time for me to hit that unsubscribe
button. And please don't misunderstand me - I'm not mad or upset or
anything; I just think it would be in my best interest to leave and
therefore not waste any more of your time (or mine, lol). But, I am
thankful for the time I was on this list and am again appreciative of your
help and I wish you well.

Blessings,

Barbara
